2025-01-13.title: Babygirl
2025-01-13.synopsis: Despite the risk and prejudices, a very successful CEO begins an illicit affair with her much younger intern.

2025-01-13.title: Nickel Boys
2025-01-13.synopsis: The Nickel Boys is based on the historic reform school in 1960s Florida called the Dozier School for Boys, which was notorious for abusive treatment of students. It explores the story of Elwood Curtis, a young African-American boy who is sent to the Nickel Academy, a fictional version of the Dozier School, after he is falsely accused of a crime. While there, he meets a boy named Turner, and the two form a close friendship as they try to survive the horrors of the school and its corrupt administrators.

2025-01-13.title: Nosferatu
2025-01-13.synopsis: Robert Eggers’ Nosferatu is a gothic tale of obsession between a haunted young woman and the terrifying vampire infatuated with her, causing untold horror in its wake.

2025-01-13.title: A Real Pain
2025-01-13.synopsis: Mismatched cousins David and Benji reunite for a tour through Poland to honor their beloved grandmother. The adventure takes a turn when the odd-couple's old tensions resurface against the backdrop of their family history.

2025-01-13.title: All We Imagine as Light
2025-01-13.synopsis:
All We Imagine as Light is a beautiful, sweeping, emotional film that explores the complexities of female friendship and captures the frantic pace, the vibrant colours and the heady atmosphere of modern Mumbai.

In the city, thoughtful Nurse Prabha’s routine is upset when she receives an unexpected gift from her estranged husband. Her younger, flightier and rebellious roommate, Anu, tries in vain to find a spot in the city to be intimate with her secret boyfriend. Their colleague Parvaty fights to stay in her home without any requisite paperwork left by her late husband. A trip to a beach town allows them each to find a space for their desires to manifest. 

Payal Kapadia’s hugely acclaimed fiction debut was the first Indian film to be selected in Official Competition at Cannes in three decades, where it was awarded the Grand Prix.

2025-01-13.title: Gladiator II
2025-01-13.synopsis: From legendary director Ridley Scott, Gladiator II continues the epic saga of power, intrigue, and vengeance set in Ancient Rome. Years after witnessing the death of the revered hero Maximus at the hands of his uncle, Lucius (Paul Mescal) is forced to enter the Colosseum after his home is conquered by the tyrannical Emperors who now lead Rome with an iron fist. With rage in his heart and the future of the Empire at stake, Lucius must look to his past to find strength and honor to return the glory of Rome to its people.

2025-01-13.title: Conclave
2025-01-13.synopsis: CONCLAVE follows one of the world’s most secretive and ancient events – selecting the new Pope. Cardinal Lawrence (Ralph Fiennes) is tasked with running this covert process after the unexpected death of the beloved Pope. Once the Catholic Church’s most powerful leaders have gathered from around the world and are locked together in the Vatican halls, Lawrence uncovers a trail of deep secrets left in the dead Pope’s wake, secrets which could shake the foundations of the Church.

2025-01-13.title: Maria
2025-01-13.synopsis:
The new film from the director of Jackie and Spencer, MARIA tells the glamorous, moving story of the iconic opera singer, Maria Callas. Paris, 1977: Once the world’s greatest soprano, Callas now hides in an apartment, having lost her voice and retreated from the world. She dreams of returning to the stage, but can her body and mind take the pressure?
Featuring some of Callas’s greatest recordings and starring Angelina Jolie in an Oscarworthy performance, MARIA is a sumptuous drama that hits all the high notes.

2025-01-13.title: We Live in Time
2025-01-13.synopsis: An up-and-coming chef and a recent divorcée find their lives forever changed when a chance encounter brings them together, in a decade-spanning, deeply moving romance.

2025-01-13.title: Anora
2025-01-13.synopsis: Anora, a young sex worker from Brooklyn, meets and impulsively marries the son of an oligarch. Once the news reaches Russia, her fairytale is threatened as the parents set out for New York to get the marriage annulled.

2025-01-13.title: Emilia Pérez
2025-01-13.synopsis: From renegade auteur Jacques Audiard comes Emilia Pérez, an audacious fever dream that defies genres and expectations. Through liberating song and dance and bold visuals, this odyssey follows the journey of four remarkable women in Mexico, each pursuing their own happiness. The fearsome cartel leader Emilia (Karla Sofía Gascón) enlists Rita (Zoe Saldaña), an unappreciated lawyer stuck in a dead-end job, to help fake her death so that Emilia can finally live authentically as her true self.

2025-01-13.title: DocHouse: Soundtrack to a Coup d'État
2025-01-13.synopsis: Jazz and decolonization are entwined in this historical rollercoaster that rewrites the Cold War episode that led musicians Abbey Lincoln and Max Roach to crash the UN Security Council in protest against the murder of Patrice Lumumba.

2025-01-14.title: Babygirl
2025-01-14.synopsis: Despite the risk and prejudices, a very successful CEO begins an illicit affair with her much younger intern.

2025-01-14.title: Gladiator II
2025-01-14.synopsis: From legendary director Ridley Scott, Gladiator II continues the epic saga of power, intrigue, and vengeance set in Ancient Rome. Years after witnessing the death of the revered hero Maximus at the hands of his uncle, Lucius (Paul Mescal) is forced to enter the Colosseum after his home is conquered by the tyrannical Emperors who now lead Rome with an iron fist. With rage in his heart and the future of the Empire at stake, Lucius must look to his past to find strength and honor to return the glory of Rome to its people.

2025-01-14.title: We Live in Time
2025-01-14.synopsis: An up-and-coming chef and a recent divorcée find their lives forever changed when a chance encounter brings them together, in a decade-spanning, deeply moving romance.

2025-01-14.title: Nosferatu
2025-01-14.synopsis: Robert Eggers’ Nosferatu is a gothic tale of obsession between a haunted young woman and the terrifying vampire infatuated with her, causing untold horror in its wake.

2025-01-14.title: A Real Pain
2025-01-14.synopsis: Mismatched cousins David and Benji reunite for a tour through Poland to honor their beloved grandmother. The adventure takes a turn when the odd-couple's old tensions resurface against the backdrop of their family history.

2025-01-14.title: Nickel Boys
2025-01-14.synopsis: The Nickel Boys is based on the historic reform school in 1960s Florida called the Dozier School for Boys, which was notorious for abusive treatment of students. It explores the story of Elwood Curtis, a young African-American boy who is sent to the Nickel Academy, a fictional version of the Dozier School, after he is falsely accused of a crime. While there, he meets a boy named Turner, and the two form a close friendship as they try to survive the horrors of the school and its corrupt administrators.

2025-01-14.title: The Order
2025-01-14.synopsis: A riveting historical thriller that recreates one of the largest manhunts in FBI history. Based on a chilling true story, THE ORDER depicts a terrorist group determined to promote their racist ideology — and the lawmen who will go to any lengths to stop them.

2025-01-14.title: Queer
2025-01-14.synopsis:
In 1950s Mexico City, William Lee (Daniel Craig), an American ex-pat in his late forties, leads a solitary life amidst a small American community. The arrival in town of Eugene Allerton, a young student, stirs William into finally establishing a meaningful connection
with someone.

2025-01-14.title: Conclave
2025-01-14.synopsis: CONCLAVE follows one of the world’s most secretive and ancient events – selecting the new Pope. Cardinal Lawrence (Ralph Fiennes) is tasked with running this covert process after the unexpected death of the beloved Pope. Once the Catholic Church’s most powerful leaders have gathered from around the world and are locked together in the Vatican halls, Lawrence uncovers a trail of deep secrets left in the dead Pope’s wake, secrets which could shake the foundations of the Church.

2025-01-14.title: Wicked
2025-01-14.synopsis:
Wicked, the untold story of the witches of Oz, stars Emmy, Grammy and Tony winning powerhouse Cynthia Erivo (Harriet, Broadway’s The Color Purple) as Elphaba, a young woman, misunderstood because of her unusual green skin, who has yet to discover her true power, and Grammy-winning, multi-platinum recording artist and global superstar Ariana Grande as Glinda, a popular young woman, gilded by privilege and ambition, who has yet to discover her true heart. 
 
The two meet as students at Shiz University in the fantastical Land of Oz and forge an unlikely but profound friendship. Following an encounter with The Wonderful Wizard of Oz, their friendship reaches a crossroads and their lives take very different paths. Glinda's unflinching desire for popularity sees her seduced by power, while Elphaba's determination to remain true to herself, and to those around her, will have unexpected and shocking consequences on her future. Their extraordinary adventures in Oz will ultimately see them fulfill their destinies as Glinda the Good and the Wicked Witch of the West.

2025-01-14.title: Maria
2025-01-14.synopsis:
The new film from the director of Jackie and Spencer, MARIA tells the glamorous, moving story of the iconic opera singer, Maria Callas. Paris, 1977: Once the world’s greatest soprano, Callas now hides in an apartment, having lost her voice and retreated from the world. She dreams of returning to the stage, but can her body and mind take the pressure?
Featuring some of Callas’s greatest recordings and starring Angelina Jolie in an Oscarworthy performance, MARIA is a sumptuous drama that hits all the high notes.

2025-01-14.title: All We Imagine as Light
2025-01-14.synopsis:
All We Imagine as Light is a beautiful, sweeping, emotional film that explores the complexities of female friendship and captures the frantic pace, the vibrant colours and the heady atmosphere of modern Mumbai.

In the city, thoughtful Nurse Prabha’s routine is upset when she receives an unexpected gift from her estranged husband. Her younger, flightier and rebellious roommate, Anu, tries in vain to find a spot in the city to be intimate with her secret boyfriend. Their colleague Parvaty fights to stay in her home without any requisite paperwork left by her late husband. A trip to a beach town allows them each to find a space for their desires to manifest. 

Payal Kapadia’s hugely acclaimed fiction debut was the first Indian film to be selected in Official Competition at Cannes in three decades, where it was awarded the Grand Prix.

2025-01-14.title: Anora
2025-01-14.synopsis: Anora, a young sex worker from Brooklyn, meets and impulsively marries the son of an oligarch. Once the news reaches Russia, her fairytale is threatened as the parents set out for New York to get the marriage annulled.

2025-01-14.title: Emilia Pérez
2025-01-14.synopsis: From renegade auteur Jacques Audiard comes Emilia Pérez, an audacious fever dream that defies genres and expectations. Through liberating song and dance and bold visuals, this odyssey follows the journey of four remarkable women in Mexico, each pursuing their own happiness. The fearsome cartel leader Emilia (Karla Sofía Gascón) enlists Rita (Zoe Saldaña), an unappreciated lawyer stuck in a dead-end job, to help fake her death so that Emilia can finally live authentically as her true self.

2025-01-14.title: The Girl with the Needle
2025-01-14.synopsis: In Copenhagen, young pregnant Karoline takes on a position as a wet nurse for an older woman named Dagmar to help support herself. Dagmar operates a clandestine adoption agency under the guise of a candy shop, assisting disadvantaged mothers place their unwanted newborns in foster homes. Karoline grows close to Dagmar, but she is soon faced with the nightmarish reality she unwittingly entered.

2025-01-14.title: DocHouse: Architecton
2025-01-14.synopsis:
The latest film from master documentarian Victor Kossakovsky (GUNDA, AQUARELA), is an epic, intimate and poetic meditation on architecture and how the design and construction of buildings from the ancient past reveal our destruction - and offer hope for survival and a way forward.

Through Kossakovsky’s lens, the grandeur and folly of humanity and its precarious relationship with nature posits two urgent questions: how do we build, and how can we build better, before it’s too late?

2025-01-14.title: DocHouse: The Bibi Files
2025-01-14.synopsis:
Using never-seen-before interrogation footage of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, his family, his closest associates, and benefactors, Director Alexis Bloom and Oscar-winning Producer Alex Gibney uncover high-level familial corruption and the disastrous lengths a political leader will go to escape accountability. THE BIBI FILES is a film about a man singularly focused on his own political survival in a region beset by war.

Leaked footage from police interrogation videos are interwoven with archival footage that shows Netanyahu’s rise to power, and how his nearly 30-year rule as Prime Minister has divided the state of Israel. Interspersed throughout are interviews with prominent journalists, Israeli statesmen, Netanyahu's associates, and longtime friends, whose observations and anecdotes reveal a chilling portrait of a leader who, in his drive to evade justice, has aligned himself with radical right-wing extremists. Netanyahu’s fixation on his entitlement to remain Prime Minister has, in this way, led to political decisions that have endangered Israel’s safety, and destroyed her standing as a democracy in the Middle East.


2025-01-14.title: DocHouse: Separated
2025-01-14.synopsis:
In his timely new film, director Errol Morris confronts one of the darkest chapters in recent American history: the policy of separating children from their parents at the US border, brought in by the Trump administration in 2017 to 2018.

Morris merges bombshell interviews with government officials and constructed vignettes of one migrant family's journey, to trace the genesis and the impact of Family Separation, showing that the cruelty at the heart of the policy was its very purpose.

With hundreds of families still separated years later, the revelations of Morris's investigation into the government's role in this unthinkable horror should hang heavy over the start of Trump's second term in office.

2025-01-15.title: A Real Pain
2025-01-15.synopsis: Mismatched cousins David and Benji reunite for a tour through Poland to honor their beloved grandmother. The adventure takes a turn when the odd-couple's old tensions resurface against the backdrop of their family history.

2025-01-15.title: The Order
2025-01-15.synopsis: A riveting historical thriller that recreates one of the largest manhunts in FBI history. Based on a chilling true story, THE ORDER depicts a terrorist group determined to promote their racist ideology — and the lawmen who will go to any lengths to stop them.

2025-01-15.title: RBO 2024-25: The Tales Of Hoffmann
2025-01-15.synopsis:
Through the haze of the years, a poet remembers the women he loved. But when it comes to matters of the heart, nothing is as it seems. Particularly when the devil himself is involved…  

Journeying back to his school days, Hoffmann relives his childhood romance with Olympia, a model student in every sense. Doomed love follows him into adulthood, where the dancer, Antonia, is taken from him too soon. Meanwhile, the sensual courtesan Giulietta has her own secret agenda. As memory and fantasy becomes increasingly blurred, will Hoffmann find the enigmatic Stella before it is too late?

2025-01-15.title: Vermiglio
2025-01-15.synopsis: 1944, Vermiglio, a remote mountain village. The arrival of Pietro, a deserter, into the family of the local teacher, and his love for the teacher's eldest daughter, will change the course of everyone's life.

2025-01-15.title: Anora
2025-01-15.synopsis: Anora, a young sex worker from Brooklyn, meets and impulsively marries the son of an oligarch. Once the news reaches Russia, her fairytale is threatened as the parents set out for New York to get the marriage annulled.

2025-01-15.title: DocHouse: The Wolves Always Come At Night
2025-01-15.synopsis:
Davaa and Zaya (co-writers of the film) live with their children and flock in the Bayankhongor region of Mongolia. But the titular wolf is never far from the door; the climate is changing, which forces the family into an urban centre and a new way of life.

A breathtaking and heartbreaking blend of documentary and fiction, this film is a timely reminder of the sometimes tenuous foundations of the places we call home, and of the imminence of climate emergency.

2025-01-15.title: DocHouse: The Bibi Files
2025-01-15.synopsis:
Using never-seen-before interrogation footage of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, his family, his closest associates, and benefactors, Director Alexis Bloom and Oscar-winning Producer Alex Gibney uncover high-level familial corruption and the disastrous lengths a political leader will go to escape accountability. Leaked footage from police interrogation videos are interwoven with archival footage that shows Netanyahu’s rise to power, and how his nearly 30-year rule as Prime Minister has divided the state of Israel. 2025-01-16.title: The Girl with the Needle
2025-01-16.synopsis: In Copenhagen, young pregnant Karoline takes on a position as a wet nurse for an older woman named Dagmar to help support herself. Dagmar operates a clandestine adoption agency under the guise of a candy shop, assisting disadvantaged mothers place their unwanted newborns in foster homes. Karoline grows close to Dagmar, but she is soon faced with the nightmarish reality she unwittingly entered.

2025-01-16.title: DocHouse: Soundtrack to a Coup d'État
2025-01-16.synopsis: Jazz and decolonization are entwined in this historical rollercoaster that rewrites the Cold War episode that led musicians Abbey Lincoln and Max Roach to crash the UN Security Council in protest against the murder of Patrice Lumumba.

2025-01-16.title: DocHouse: Architecton
2025-01-16.synopsis:
The latest film from master documentarian Victor Kossakovsky (GUNDA, AQUARELA), is an epic, intimate and poetic meditation on architecture and how the design and construction of buildings from the ancient past reveal our destruction - and offer hope for survival and a way forward.

Through Kossakovsky’s lens, the grandeur and folly of humanity and its precarious relationship with nature posits two urgent questions: how do we build, and how can we build better, before it’s too late?

2025-01-16.title: DocHouse: Separated
2025-01-16.synopsis:
In his timely new film, director Errol Morris confronts one of the darkest chapters in recent American history: the policy of separating children from their parents at the US border, brought in by the Trump administration in 2017 to 2018.

Morris merges bombshell interviews with government officials and constructed vignettes of one migrant family's journey, to trace the genesis and the impact of Family Separation, showing that the cruelty at the heart of the policy was its very purpose.

With hundreds of families still separated years later, the revelations of Morris's investigation into the government's role in this unthinkable horror should hang heavy over the start of Trump's second term in office.

2025-01-17.title: Emilia Pérez
2025-01-17.synopsis: From renegade auteur Jacques Audiard comes Emilia Pérez, an audacious fever dream that defies genres and expectations. Through liberating song and dance and bold visuals, this odyssey follows the journey of four remarkable women in Mexico, each pursuing their own happiness. The fearsome cartel leader Emilia (Karla Sofía Gascón) enlists Rita (Zoe Saldaña), an unappreciated lawyer stuck in a dead-end job, to help fake her death so that Emilia can finally live authentically as her true self.

2025-01-17.title: A Real Pain
2025-01-17.synopsis: Mismatched cousins David and Benji reunite for a tour through Poland to honor their beloved grandmother. The adventure takes a turn when the odd-couple's old tensions resurface against the backdrop of their family history.

2025-01-17.title: Babygirl
2025-01-17.synopsis: Despite the risk and prejudices, a very successful CEO begins an illicit affair with her much younger intern.

2025-01-17.title: A Complete Unknown
2025-01-17.synopsis: Set in the influential New York music scene of the early 60s, A COMPLETE UNKNOWN follows 19-year-old Minnesota musician BOB DYLAN’s (Timothée Chalamet) meteoric rise as a folk singer to concert halls and the top of the charts – his songs and mystique becoming a worldwide sensation – culminating in his groundbreaking electric rock and roll performance at the Newport Folk Festival in 1965.

2025-01-17.title: Nosferatu
2025-01-17.synopsis: Robert Eggers’ Nosferatu is a gothic tale of obsession between a haunted young woman and the terrifying vampire infatuated with her, causing untold horror in its wake.

2025-01-17.title: Nickel Boys
2025-01-17.synopsis: The Nickel Boys is based on the historic reform school in 1960s Florida called the Dozier School for Boys, which was notorious for abusive treatment of students. It explores the story of Elwood Curtis, a young African-American boy who is sent to the Nickel Academy, a fictional version of the Dozier School, after he is falsely accused of a crime. While there, he meets a boy named Turner, and the two form a close friendship as they try to survive the horrors of the school and its corrupt administrators.

2025-01-17.title: LSFF 2025: Opening Night Programme
2025-01-17.synopsis:
Halcyon Days: Radical Short Films of the 1990s


What came before LSFF? Some may know that the festival began its life as the Halloween Society, an itinerant London film club co-founded by Philip Ilson in 1994; one of many underground, alternative film collectives across the capital and across the decade.  


Positioned firmly outside of the mainstream, the filmmakers that emerged from the scene nevertheless began to receive funding from the BFI, Channel 4 and Arts Councill England to create new work, whilst retaining a DIY, kinetic and radical spirit on the screen. Britpop and Cool Brittania may have dominated the media mainstream, but this rich seam of underground filmmaking and basement screenings offered a snapshot of real life from across London.


This special opening screening of LSFF brings together rarely-seen early films from filmmakers including Peter Strickland, Carol Morley, Andrea Luka Zimmerman and Alnoor Dewshi. 


The filmmakers will join us after the screening for an extended Q&A.


Latifah and Himli's Nomadic Uncle (Alnoor Dewshi, 1992, 17 mins)
I'm Not Here (Carol Morley, 1994, 15 min)
The Hackney Downs (Jamie Thraves, 1995, 13 mins)
The Insect House (Seonaid MacKay, 3 mins, 1995)
Horseplay (Alison Murray, 5 mins, 1995)
Bubblegum (Peter Strickland, 15 mins, 1996)
Raj or Radge? (Menhaj Huda, 3mins, 1999)
Flying for One Minute (Andrea Luka Zimmerman, 2 mins, 2001)
Maldoror: The Spectator of Outrageous Contortion (Steven Eastwood, 2000, 6 mins)

2025-01-17.title: Maria
2025-01-17.synopsis:
The new film from the director of Jackie and Spencer, MARIA tells the glamorous, moving story of the iconic opera singer, Maria Callas. Paris, 1977: Once the world’s greatest soprano, Callas now hides in an apartment, having lost her voice and retreated from the world. She dreams of returning to the stage, but can her body and mind take the pressure?
Featuring some of Callas’s greatest recordings and starring Angelina Jolie in an Oscarworthy performance, MARIA is a sumptuous drama that hits all the high notes.

2025-01-17.title: Here
2025-01-17.synopsis: From the reunited director, writer, and stars of Forrest Gump, Here is an original film about multiple families and a special place they inhabit. The story travels through generations, capturing the human experience in its purest form. Directed by Robert Zemeckis, screenplay by Eric Roth & Zemeckis and told much in the style of the acclaimed graphic novel by Richard McGuire on which it is based, Tom Hanks and Robin Wright star in a tale of love, loss, laughter and life, all of which happen right Here.

2025-01-17.title: Conclave
2025-01-17.synopsis: CONCLAVE follows one of the world’s most secretive and ancient events – selecting the new Pope. Cardinal Lawrence (Ralph Fiennes) is tasked with running this covert process after the unexpected death of the beloved Pope. Once the Catholic Church’s most powerful leaders have gathered from around the world and are locked together in the Vatican halls, Lawrence uncovers a trail of deep secrets left in the dead Pope’s wake, secrets which could shake the foundations of the Church.

2025-01-17.title: Anora
2025-01-17.synopsis: Anora, a young sex worker from Brooklyn, meets and impulsively marries the son of an oligarch. Once the news reaches Russia, her fairytale is threatened as the parents set out for New York to get the marriage annulled.

2025-01-17.title: Vermiglio
2025-01-17.synopsis: 1944, Vermiglio, a remote mountain village. The arrival of Pietro, a deserter, into the family of the local teacher, and his love for the teacher's eldest daughter, will change the course of everyone's life.

2025-01-17.title: All We Imagine as Light
2025-01-17.synopsis:
All We Imagine as Light is a beautiful, sweeping, emotional film that explores the complexities of female friendship and captures the frantic pace, the vibrant colours and the heady atmosphere of modern Mumbai.

In the city, thoughtful Nurse Prabha’s routine is upset when she receives an unexpected gift from her estranged husband. Her younger, flightier and rebellious roommate, Anu, tries in vain to find a spot in the city to be intimate with her secret boyfriend. Their colleague Parvaty fights to stay in her home without any requisite paperwork left by her late husband. A trip to a beach town allows them each to find a space for their desires to manifest. 

Payal Kapadia’s hugely acclaimed fiction debut was the first Indian film to be selected in Official Competition at Cannes in three decades, where it was awarded the Grand Prix.

2025-01-17.title: DocHouse: Grand Theft Hamlet
2025-01-17.synopsis:
Two jobless actors attempt to stage a production of Hamlet entirely within the video game Grand Theft Auto - an ambitious quest that turns out to be both absurdly funny and unexpectedly moving.

January 2021. The UK is in another lockdown and all entertainment venues remain closed. For theatre actors Sam and Mark, the future looks bleak. As the pandemic drags on, they spend their days in the online digital world of Grand Theft Auto and when they stumble across a theatre, the idea to stage a full Shakespeare play quickly takes shape.

Filmed entirely within GTA, GRAND THEFT HAMLET charts their ridiculous, hilarious adventure, through casting, rehearsals and performance, as they battle violent griefers and discover surprising truths about life, friendship and the enduring power of Shakespeare.

2025-01-17.title: DocHouse: Separated
2025-01-17.synopsis:
In his timely new film, director Errol Morris confronts one of the darkest chapters in recent American history: the policy of separating children from their parents at the US border, brought in by the Trump administration in 2017 to 2018.

Morris merges bombshell interviews with government officials and constructed vignettes of one migrant family's journey, to trace the genesis and the impact of Family Separation, showing that the cruelty at the heart of the policy was its very purpose.

With hundreds of families still separated years later, the revelations of Morris's investigation into the government's role in this unthinkable horror should hang heavy over the start of Trump's second term in office.

2025-01-17.title: DocHouse: My Stolen Planet
2025-01-17.synopsis:
Using her own home movies and a trove of collected 8mm archive, Iranian filmmaker Farahnaz Sharifi reveals the dual existences lived by women in Iran.

Sharifi was born during the Islamic revolution in Iran in 1979, and finds her life divided between a public world of silence and submission, and the domestic world that she shares with other women behind closed doors. Her beautifully-constructed film diary captures the joy, music and defiance of this hidden life, navigating the contrast between unseen freedom and external oppression.

2025-01-17.title: DocHouse: Architecton
2025-01-17.synopsis:
The latest film from master documentarian Victor Kossakovsky (GUNDA, AQUARELA), is an epic, intimate and poetic meditation on architecture and how the design and construction of buildings from the ancient past reveal our destruction - and offer hope for survival and a way forward.

Through Kossakovsky’s lens, the grandeur and folly of humanity and its precarious relationship with nature posits two urgent questions: how do we build, and how can we build better, before it’s too late?

2025-01-18.title: LSFF 2025: Gothic
2025-01-18.synopsis:
From abstract eeriness to haunting dramas, our returning anthology of Gothic shorts calls you towards the dark and surreal.

A father struggles with empty nest syndrome in a disturbing body horror, dark academia gets darker in a horrifying night in a library, a creepy mockumentary offers a glimpse into a woman’s sewer life, a girl convinced she’s a vampire battles her loneliness, an abstract animation takes us through a woman’s strange rainy night, a freakish animation turns a mermaid into a nightmare, and a mash-up of Children of the Damned and The Sound of Music becomes a surreal alchemic experiment.

Rain, Rain Go Away, dir. Ronan Mackenzie, UK 2024, 13mins
Woe, dir. Max Davies, UK 2023, 7mins 
Stomach Bug, dir. Matty Crawford, UK 2024, 15mins
Sound of the Damned, dir. David Leister, UK 2024, 3mins
Unwell Woman, dir. Daniella DeVinter, UK 2024, 14mins
La Voix Des Sirènes, dir. Gianluigi Toccafondo, Italy 2023, 20mins
Transylvanie, dir. Rodrigue Huart, France 2023, 15mins

Content warning: Gore, Blood

2025-01-18.title: Kids Club: The Wild Robot
2025-01-18.synopsis: The Wild Robot” follows Rozzum 7134 (“Roz” for short), a futuristic robot that washes ashore on a deserted island. A tale of survival and discovery begins when she becomes the unexpected protector to an orphaned gosling, which she names Brightbill. Together they struggle to survive the harsh environment, but only succeed with the help of a close-knit group of misfit animals, who become first friends, then family. Ultimately Roz and company save the island from a robotic invasion by Roz’s manufacturer, looking to bring her back to civilization by any means necessary.

2025-01-18.title: We Live in Time
2025-01-18.synopsis: An up-and-coming chef and a recent divorcée find their lives forever changed when a chance encounter brings them together, in a decade-spanning, deeply moving romance.

2025-01-18.title: Anora
2025-01-18.synopsis: Anora, a young sex worker from Brooklyn, meets and impulsively marries the son of an oligarch. Once the news reaches Russia, her fairytale is threatened as the parents set out for New York to get the marriage annulled.

2025-01-18.title: DocHouse: 2073
2025-01-18.synopsis:
2073 blends compelling archive footage and commentary with sci-fi drama in this vital cinematic warning from a dystopian future to tackle the biggest challenges endangering our present day and the existence of humanity.

It’s the year 2073 where the worst fears of modern life have been realised. Surveillance drones fill the burnt orange skies and militarised police roam the wrecked streets, while humans hide away underground, struggling to remember a free and hopeful existence. In this ingenious mixture of visionary science fiction and nonfiction, Oscar-winning director, Asif Kapadia (SENNA, AMY) transports us to a future foreshadowed by the terrifying realities of our present. Samantha Morton (MINORITY REPORT) plays a survivor besieged by nightmare visions of the past—a past that happens to be our present, visualised through contemporary footage interconnecting today’s global crises of authoritarianism, unchecked big tech, inequality, and our global climate crisis.

2073 is an urgent, unshakable vision of a dystopic future that could very well be our own.

2025-01-18.title: DocHouse: My Stolen Planet
2025-01-18.synopsis:
Using her own home movies and a trove of collected 8mm archive, Iranian filmmaker Farahnaz Sharifi reveals the dual existences lived by women in Iran.

2025-01-19.title: LSFF 2025: Fantastic Fictions
2025-01-19.synopsis:
We say cinema is larger than life, that it is imbued with our fantasies, dreams, desires. Surreal, moody, edgy, this year’s Fantastic Fictions is bulging with urges and provocations. These films are deep dives into the psychologies—human and non-human—that encapsulate the zeitgeist of our era. And behind the whimsical stories, there are sighs of resignation and footprints of the Imp of the Perverse.

A parody western musical, a teenage girl’s damp daydream, a middle-age woman’s imaginative escape from the monotony of married life, a grand tour around the wasteland of computer graphics where memories are as malleable as distorted skin texture. No matter ifit’s two dogs’ existential awakening, a spider’s witness of an apocalypse, or two friends’ bougie self-care weekend trip to a sterling-haunted forest, reveries bleed into the screen and image becomes a delicate reality. 

Atom and Void, dir. Gonçalo Almeida, Portugal 2024, 9mins
The Dogs, dir. George Moore Chadwick, UK 2023, 3mins
The Green Country, dir. Silvia Rossi, Norway 2024, 19mins
A Brighter Summer Day for the Lady Avengers, dir. Birdy Wei-Ting Hung, Taiwan 2024, 12mins
Dangerous Romance, dir. Daisy Jacobs, UK 2024, 12mins
Melody of Love, dir. Guy Kozak, USA 2024, 10mins
Shotplayer, dir. Sam Shainberg, USA 2023, 20mins
Aferrado, dir. Esteban Azuela, Mexico 2024, 18mins

2025-01-19.title: RBO 2024-25: The Tales Of Hoffmann
2025-01-19.synopsis:
Through the haze of the years, a poet remembers the women he loved. But when it comes to matters of the heart, nothing is as it seems. Particularly when the devil himself is involved…  

Journeying back to his school days, Hoffmann relives his childhood romance with Olympia, a model student in every sense. Doomed love follows him into adulthood, where the dancer, Antonia, is taken from him too soon. Meanwhile, the sensual courtesan Giulietta has her own secret agenda. As memory and fantasy becomes increasingly blurred, will Hoffmann find the enigmatic Stella before it is too late?

2025-01-19.title: We Live in Time
2025-01-19.synopsis: An up-and-coming chef and a recent divorcée find their lives forever changed when a chance encounter brings them together, in a decade-spanning, deeply moving romance.

2025-01-19.title: DocHouse: Favoriten
2025-01-19.synopsis:
Acclaimed filmmaker Ruth Beckermann takes us to Favoriten, one of the most culturally diverse neighbourhoods in Vienna, and right into a busy primary school classroom.

Beckermann spent three years following a class of pupils, from the age of seven to ten, and their ambitious, energetic and devoted teacher, Ilkay. The majority of children don’t speak German at home, some families are wounded by war experience and many face discrimination, but Ilkay is determined to create an inclusive, supportive and safe environment gently guiding her class through their daily adventures, defeats and victories.

FAVORITEN is an ode to childhood and a surprisingly cheerful portrait of a small community mirroring the complexities of contemporary European society.

2025-01-19.title: DocHouse: Soundtrack to a Coup d'État
2025-01-19.synopsis: Jazz and decolonization are entwined in this historical rollercoaster that rewrites the Cold War episode that led musicians Abbey Lincoln and Max Roach to crash the UN Security Council in protest against the murder of Patrice Lumumba.

2025-01-20.title: Emilia Pérez
2025-01-20.synopsis: From renegade auteur Jacques Audiard comes Emilia Pérez, an audacious fever dream that defies genres and expectations. Through liberating song and dance and bold visuals, this odyssey follows the journey of four remarkable women in Mexico, each pursuing their own happiness. The fearsome cartel leader Emilia (Karla Sofía Gascón) enlists Rita (Zoe Saldaña), an unappreciated lawyer stuck in a dead-end job, to help fake her death so that Emilia can finally live authentically as her true self.

2025-01-20.title: A Real Pain
2025-01-20.synopsis: Mismatched cousins David and Benji reunite for a tour through Poland to honor their beloved grandmother. The adventure takes a turn when the odd-couple's old tensions resurface against the backdrop of their family history.

2025-01-20.title: Babygirl
2025-01-20.synopsis: Despite the risk and prejudices, a very successful CEO begins an illicit affair with her much younger intern.

2025-01-20.title: A Complete Unknown
2025-01-20.synopsis: Set in the influential New York music scene of the early 60s, A COMPLETE UNKNOWN follows 19-year-old Minnesota musician BOB DYLAN’s (Timothée Chalamet) meteoric rise as a folk singer to concert halls and the top of the charts – his songs and mystique becoming a worldwide sensation – culminating in his groundbreaking electric rock and roll performance at the Newport Folk Festival in 1965.

2025-01-20.title: Nosferatu
2025-01-20.synopsis: Robert Eggers’ Nosferatu is a gothic tale of obsession between a haunted young woman and the terrifying vampire infatuated with her, causing untold horror in its wake.

2025-01-20.title: Nickel Boys
2025-01-20.synopsis: The Nickel Boys is based on the historic reform school in 1960s Florida called the Dozier School for Boys, which was notorious for abusive treatment of students. It explores the story of Elwood Curtis, a young African-American boy who is sent to the Nickel Academy, a fictional version of the Dozier School, after he is falsely accused of a crime. While there, he meets a boy named Turner, and the two form a close friendship as they try to survive the horrors of the school and its corrupt administrators.

2025-01-20.title: LSFF 2025: The Last Invention
2025-01-20.synopsis:
Are we approaching a technological singularity? Are we seeing a technocratic dystopia dawning upon us? As we are marching towards the fourth decade of the 21st century, new technology has only become more scary than exciting, more uncanny than friendly. Films in this program reflect such anxiety of ours, and beg the question—as they move between documentary and speculative fiction: Is this a future we want?

There are many films in the program that blend experimental elements of AI with conventional filmmaking. A docu-fiction of rediscovered Bangladroids who recall, in poetry, their past lives. A farce about a man obsessed with a broken bench underpinned by a rock. From a brief history of 20th century technological advance, to a crash course on AI literacy and how to safeguard our genuine reality, then to the invasion of social media that has fundamentally reconfigured the coming-of-age years of teenagers, you are here for unhinged images, unsettling stories, and visualisation of outlandish worlds where technology seems to be demanding its own autonomy — if not its control over us humans.

We Made Telephones, dir. Ben Young, UK 2024, 10mins
Christmas, Every Day, dir. Faye Tsakas, USA 2024, 14mins
Data Flesh, dir. Felipe Elgueta, Chile 2024, 5mins
The Future Can Be Yours, dir. Simon Ball, UK 2024, 9mins
The Oasis I Deserve, dir. Inès Sieulle, France 2022, 22mins
Do Bangladroids Dream of Electric Tagore?, dir. Aleem Hossain, USA 2024, 3mins
The Moment of Truth, dir. David Baksh, UK 2024, 13mins
Nobody Wants To Fix Things Anymore, dir. Joseph Wilcox, USA 2023, 4mins
Shokouk: A Cosmicomedy in Four Acts, dir. Felix Kalmenson / Rouzbeh Akhbari, Uzbekistan, 17mins

2025-01-20.title: Maria
2025-01-20.synopsis:
The new film from the director of Jackie and Spencer, MARIA tells the glamorous, moving story of the iconic opera singer, Maria Callas. Paris, 1977: Once the world’s greatest soprano, Callas now hides in an apartment, having lost her voice and retreated from the world. She dreams of returning to the stage, but can her body and mind take the pressure?
Featuring some of Callas’s greatest recordings and starring Angelina Jolie in an Oscarworthy performance, MARIA is a sumptuous drama that hits all the high notes.

2025-01-20.title: Here
2025-01-20.synopsis: From the reunited director, writer, and stars of Forrest Gump, Here is an original film about multiple families and a special place they inhabit. The story travels through generations, capturing the human experience in its purest form. Directed by Robert Zemeckis, screenplay by Eric Roth & Zemeckis and told much in the style of the acclaimed graphic novel by Richard McGuire on which it is based, Tom Hanks and Robin Wright star in a tale of love, loss, laughter and life, all of which happen right Here.

2025-01-20.title: Conclave
2025-01-20.synopsis: CONCLAVE follows one of the world’s most secretive and ancient events – selecting the new Pope. Cardinal Lawrence (Ralph Fiennes) is tasked with running this covert process after the unexpected death of the beloved Pope. Once the Catholic Church’s most powerful leaders have gathered from around the world and are locked together in the Vatican halls, Lawrence uncovers a trail of deep secrets left in the dead Pope’s wake, secrets which could shake the foundations of the Church.

2025-01-20.title: We Live in Time
2025-01-20.synopsis: An up-and-coming chef and a recent divorcée find their lives forever changed when a chance encounter brings them together, in a decade-spanning, deeply moving romance.

2025-01-20.title: Anora
2025-01-20.synopsis: Anora, a young sex worker from Brooklyn, meets and impulsively marries the son of an oligarch. Once the news reaches Russia, her fairytale is threatened as the parents set out for New York to get the marriage annulled.

2025-01-20.title: Vermiglio
2025-01-20.synopsis: 1944, Vermiglio, a remote mountain village. The arrival of Pietro, a deserter, into the family of the local teacher, and his love for the teacher's eldest daughter, will change the course of everyone's life.

2025-01-20.title: All We Imagine as Light
2025-01-20.synopsis:
All We Imagine as Light is a beautiful, sweeping, emotional film that explores the complexities of female friendship and captures the frantic pace, the vibrant colours and the heady atmosphere of modern Mumbai.

In the city, thoughtful Nurse Prabha’s routine is upset when she receives an unexpected gift from her estranged husband. Her younger, flightier and rebellious roommate, Anu, tries in vain to find a spot in the city to be intimate with her secret boyfriend. Their colleague Parvaty fights to stay in her home without any requisite paperwork left by her late husband. A trip to a beach town allows them each to find a space for their desires to manifest. 

Payal Kapadia’s hugely acclaimed fiction debut was the first Indian film to be selected in Official Competition at Cannes in three decades, where it was awarded the Grand Prix.

2025-01-20.title: DocHouse: Architecton
2025-01-20.synopsis:
The latest film from master documentarian Victor Kossakovsky (GUNDA, AQUARELA), is an epic, intimate and poetic meditation on architecture and how the design and construction of buildings from the ancient past reveal our destruction - and offer hope for survival and a way forward.

Through Kossakovsky’s lens, the grandeur and folly of humanity and its precarious relationship with nature posits two urgent questions: how do we build, and how can we build better, before it’s too late?

2025-01-20.title: DocHouse: My Stolen Planet
2025-01-20.synopsis:
Using her own home movies and a trove of collected 8mm archive, Iranian filmmaker Farahnaz Sharifi reveals the dual existences lived by women in Iran.

Sharifi was born during the Islamic revolution in Iran in 1979, and finds her life divided between a public world of silence and submission, and the domestic world that she shares with other women behind closed doors. Her beautifully-constructed film diary captures the joy, music and defiance of this hidden life, navigating the contrast between unseen freedom and external oppression.

2025-01-20.title: DocHouse: Grand Theft Hamlet
2025-01-20.synopsis:
Two jobless actors attempt to stage a production of Hamlet entirely within the video game Grand Theft Auto - an ambitious quest that turns out to be both absurdly funny and unexpectedly moving.

January 2021. The UK is in another lockdown and all entertainment venues remain closed. For theatre actors Sam and Mark, the future looks bleak. As the pandemic drags on, they spend their days in the online digital world of Grand Theft Auto and when they stumble across a theatre, the idea to stage a full Shakespeare play quickly takes shape.

Filmed entirely within GTA, GRAND THEFT HAMLET charts their ridiculous, hilarious adventure, through casting, rehearsals and performance, as they battle violent griefers and discover surprising truths about life, friendship and the enduring power of Shakespeare.

2025-01-20.title: DocHouse: The Bibi Files
2025-01-20.synopsis:
Using never-seen-before interrogation footage of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, his family, his closest associates, and benefactors, Director Alexis Bloom and Oscar-winning Producer Alex Gibney uncover high-level familial corruption and the disastrous lengths a political leader will go to escape accountability. THE BIBI FILES is a film about a man singularly focused on his own political survival in a region beset by war.

Leaked footage from police interrogation videos are interwoven with archival footage that shows Netanyahu’s rise to power, and how his nearly 30-year rule as Prime Minister has divided the state of Israel. Interspersed throughout are interviews with prominent journalists, Israeli statesmen, Netanyahu's associates, and longtime friends, whose observations and anecdotes reveal a chilling portrait of a leader who, in his drive to evade justice, has aligned himself with radical right-wing extremists. Netanyahu’s fixation on his entitlement to remain Prime Minister has, in this way, led to political decisions that have endangered Israel’s safety, and destroyed her standing as a democracy in the Middle East.

